most_active_tickets.title: Pieces OS doesn't start because it's unable to open database due to corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized.
Pieces OS doesn't start due to database corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized. #686

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Database Corruption on Startup
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces OS failing to start due to database corruption on both Windows and macOS.  Error messages point to issues with database initialization.  Suggested workarounds include reinstalling the app, but the issue persists for some users. The Pieces team is actively investigating and requesting logs for diagnosis.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS doesn't start because it's unable to open database due to corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized.
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS doesn't start because it's unable to open database due to corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized.
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The latest version doesn't start. 

Here is the log in com.pieces.os/production/Support/logs:

## Conversation Summary of GitHub Issue #686

**Key Points Raised:**

* User antoine79 experiences an initial bootup issue with their Pieces database.
* User antoine79 is a new user and is unsure about the database location.
* User NidroySoft reports the same issue on the latest version (11.3.1) with additional log information.
* The Pieces support team acknowledges the issue and is investigating.

**Problems Identified:**

* Database corruption during initial bootup.
* Persistent issue with database even after deleting and reinstalling the application.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Potential fix implemented in version 11.3.1 with additional logging for diagnosis.
* Scheduled support call with user antoine79 for further troubleshooting.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue remains unresolved for some users, including antoine79.
* Further investigation and troubleshooting ongoing by the Pieces support team.

**Additional Notes:**

* User NidroySoft provided detailed log information which may assist in identifying the root cause.
* The Pieces support team is actively engaged in resolving the issue and providing assistance to affected users.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS doesn't start due to database corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized. #686
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS doesn't start due to database corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized. #686
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

Early Access Program

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces OS fails to start because it is unable to open the database due to corruption. The error message displayed is: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized.

Steps to Reproduce:

Attempt to start Pieces OS on macOS.
Observe the error message indicating database corruption.
Expected Behavior: I expected Pieces OS to start normally and access the database without any issues.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* User (@moazzem-pixel) reported an issue with Pieces OS not starting due to database corruption.
* The issue was automatically triaged by the Pieces support bot and assigned to the relevant team member.
* Related issues and resources were suggested for the user's reference.
* Another Pieces team member (@mark-at-pieces) identified the issue as a duplicate of a previously reported issue (https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/686).

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces OS was unable to open the database due to corruption.
* This issue prevented the user from launching the application.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* None specifically mentioned, but the user was directed to a duplicate issue (https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/686) where a solution might be available.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue was identified as a duplicate and the user was directed to the original issue for further discussion and resolution.

related_issues.title: Stuck at https://authentication.pieces.services/
related_issues.text:
Stuck at https://authentication.pieces.services/
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After updating pieces to latest version, I was loggged out (This was part of the update, which I saw in the update / release notes.). But when I try to log in, always end up at https://authentication.pieces.services/ without moving forward. that page keep loading and nothing happens.
## Summary of GitHub issue conversation "Authentication issue after Pieces OS update (11.3.0)"

**Key points raised:**

* Users reported an issue where they could not link their Google account after updating Pieces OS to version 11.3.0 on Windows 11.
* The login page https://authentication.pieces.services/ would infinitely load, preventing them from logging in with Google or GitHub.

**Problems identified:**

* The issue appeared to be related to the authentication flow introduced in a recent update.
* The problem affected users on Windows 11 who updated to Pieces OS version 11.3.0.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* The team requested users to try logging in via the Pieces toolbar or the Connect Account button in the Pieces Desktop app.
* They asked for troubleshooting information through screen recordings, support logs, and scheduling support calls.
* The team identified and fixed the issue within a few hours of the reports.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The authentication issue has been resolved.
* Users are now able to successfully link their Google accounts.
* The issue has been closed.

**Additional notes:**

* The team confirmed that the issue was related to the new authentication flow.
* They expressed gratitude to the users who reported the problem and provided helpful information.

recommendations: **Prioritize database corruption issue:** Allocate resources to urgently investigate and resolve the root cause of the database corruption issue impacting Pieces OS startup on Windows and macOS. This issue has the highest frequency and is causing significant user frustration.

**Improve authentication flow:** While the authentication issue (ticket #685) is resolved, its high activity level suggests potential for improvement. Review the authentication flow, identify any friction points, and simplify the process for a smoother user experience.

**Enhance error messaging:** Provide more user-friendly error messages for database corruption issues. Instead of technical jargon, guide users towards potential solutions like reinstalling the app or contacting support.
**Develop proactive measures:** Explore implementing database integrity checks or backups to prevent corruption and minimize data loss for users.

**Improve issue duplication handling:** While ticket #688 was marked as a duplicate, its activity level suggests potential for improvement. Ensure users are automatically directed to the primary issue and provided with clear updates and solutions from the primary ticket.
**Gather more diagnostic information:** Request detailed logs and system information from users experiencing the database corruption issue to aid in diagnosis and resolution.
**Consider platform-specific troubleshooting:** Given the issue appears on both Windows and macOS, develop platform-specific troubleshooting guides for users and support agents.
**Proactively communicate known issues:** Maintain a publicly accessible list of known issues and workarounds to keep users informed and reduce support ticket volume.
